intro: Galium clausonis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic to lanceolate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Small white or pale yellow flowers appear in clusters during the summer months, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
